Tier 3

New Support for Developers Using Visual Studio 2012

Iron Foundry developers are likely to use a whole host of different IDEs to build and deploy applications. For those building .NET applications, Visual Studio is likely the development environment of choice. Iron Foundry developers can now push and manage apps directly from Visual Studio 2012 using the upgraded Visual Studio Extension. Now, from either Visual Studio 2010 or Visual Studio 2010, developers can push .NET 4.0 apps to any Iron Foundry-compliant endpoint. ASP.NET web applications (or WCF services) can be deployed or redeployed from this tool,. In addition, developers can see all the applications deployed to a given Iron Foundry cloud, and even change resource allocations for a given application. Feel free to go download this latest Visual Studio extension today!
